page.title: 04THE ATTRACTIONS OF MIDHURST
page.content: Tourists come to Midhurst from Britain and overseas,especially Holland Germany and America.Most arrive by car and coach.The Dutch often bring bicycles.Some come for the attractive scenery or the many old buildings like the Library.There are a great many pubs and taverns as well as 2 A.A. listed hotels.Numerous antique shops attract visitors to the town.They also come to see the polo and explore Cowdray Ruins.Polo is played in the summer on Wednesday,Saturday and Sunday.Prince Charles,a popular member of the Royal Family,often plays polo here.Midhurst is a pleasant old town with much to attract tourists.Much of its wealth comes from tourist trade.In the summer months many local households use spare bedrooms to provide overnight accommodation for tourists.
